title: Curtis Stone: 'Why I turned down an offer to be a judge on MasterChef'
text:
Celebrity chef Curtis Stone has revealed he turned down an offer from Channel 10 to be a full-time judge on MasterChef Australia.

The network announced in July that longtime judges George Calombaris, Gary Mehigan and Matt Preston had quit after contract negotiations broke down.

After a three-month search, Channel 10 recently announced the show's new hosts: Jock Zonfrillo, Melissa Leong and Andy Allen.

'They reached out early on': Celebrity chef Curtis Stone (pictured) has revealed why he turned down an offer to be a judge on MasterChef Australia

Curtis said he was shocked by Matt, George and Gary's departure, adding that Channel 10 asked him if he would consider stepping in.

'I've had a long relationship with those guys and they reached out early on and asked if I wanted to come on and be a part of it,' he told News.com.au.

The chef, who owns two restaurants in Los Angeles, said he turned them down because he could not find the time to accommodate the filming schedule.

Out with the old! Channel 10 announced in July that longtime judges George Calombaris, Gary Mehigan and Matt Preston (pictured) had quit after contract negotiations broke down

'My work commitments are pretty intense back in the States and I've got two kids and a wife and a couple of restaurants. They film that show for a very long time so I wouldn't be able to do that,' he said.

Curtis added that he is interested to see how the next season of MasterChef plays out and said the show's success was due to its format and not necessarily the hosts.

'I've probably done one or two episodes [as a guest judge] in each of the seasons so far, so it'll probably be the same [next year]. I'll just pop in once or twice,' he added.

The new faces: After a three-month search, Channel 10 recently announced the show's new hosts: Jock Zonfrillo, Melissa Leong and Andy Allen (pictured)

Meanwhile, it's rumoured that Gary Mehigan and Matt Preston will host an as-yet-untitled cooking program with radio star Jane Kennedy on Channel Seven next year.

George Calombaris, whose public image has taken a battering this year after a series of scandals, is reportedly not involved in the project.

It's expected the show will be announced at Seven's Upfronts on Wednesday afternoon.
description: Celebrity chef Curtis Stone has revealed he turned down an offer from Channel 10 to be a full-time judge on MasterChef Australia.
authors: Tom Place For Daily Mail Australia
